Description: This event will help demonstrate how a ticket can be sold to a general admission seating assignment event.
Test event - GA

February 13-15, 20-22
A Night of Noh Theatre
Conceived and Directed by Tamiko Washington

The beauty of movement comes to life in this innovative and original adaptation of Japanese Noh Theatre, transformed on the stage using Tadashi Suzuki’s captivating movement style.  If you have the desire to be visually intrigued by the art of expressive storytelling, embracing unique and stunning physical theatre, please join us for an evening of unforgettable entertainment that will leave you wanting more.

Waltmar Theatre
7:30pm, with an additional performance Feb. 22 at 2pm
$20 general admission; $15 senior citizens, students and alumni

April 10-12, 17-19
Machinal by Sophie Treadwell
Directed by Matthew McCray

Trapped first in a dead-end job and then a loveless marriage, Helen longs for a bit of joy and tenderness that her harsh and male-dominated world cannot provide. Sophie Treadwell's brilliant 1929 expressionistic play explores gender roles and the illusion of choice in contemporary society. With a large cast, integrated media and sonic score, this production is a post-modern examination of how suppression can drive an individual to commit desperate and horrible acts.

Waltmar Theatre
7:30pm, with an additional performance Apr. 19 at 2pm
$20 general admission; $15 senior citizens, students and alumni

Event Title: Guest Artist in Recital - Bruce Sledge, tenor
Description:
Guest Artist in Recital - Bruce Sledge, tenor with Cheryl Fielding, pianist

Program to include works by Bellini, Duparc, Rachmaninov, Strauss and Puccini.

About Bruce Sledge:
Bruce Sledge is one of today’s most in-demand tenori di grazia and sings a wide variety of repertoire with many international houses.  Last season, Mr. Sledge returned to the Metropolitan Opera in two Mozart roles: Tamino in The Magic Flute and Ferrando in Così Fan Tutte.  Additionally, Mr. Sledge made his debut with the Minnesota Opera in a new role, Leicester in Donizetti’s Maria Stuarda, followed by Tamino with the Manitoba Opera and Almaviva in Hamburg and in Grand Rapids before making his debut in Avenches, Switzerland, as the Duke of Mantua in Rigoletto.  In concert he was heard in Mozart’s Requiem with the San Francisco Symphony and in Schubert’s Mass No. 6 with the San Diego Symphony.  For the 2011-2012 season he returns to the Metropolitan Opera for Don Ottavio in a new production of Don Giovanni and Paolo in Rossini’s Maometto Il with Santa Fe Opera.  Future projects include a return to the Metropolitan Opera and a debut with the Welsh National Opera.  Learn more...

Event Title: Guest Artist in Recital - Third Wheel Trio
Description:
Guest Artist in Recital - Third Wheel Trio

Adrienne Geffen, clarinet; Karin Kantenwein Fabiero, flute; and Rebecca Rivera, bassoon.

Locally grown chamber music. Program to be announced.

Event Title: Guest Artists in Recital - Da Capo
Description:
Guest Artists in Recital - Da Capo

Program to include works by Chinary Ung, Sean Heim, Yumiko Morita, and Aaron Gervais - including the west coast premier of the chamber version of Chinary Ung’s critically acclaimed viola concerto, Singing Inside Aura, featuring Susan Ung - viola soloist.

Guest Artists in Recital - Bin Huang, violin & Yin Zheng, piano

Bin Huang, Gold Medalist at the Paganini Competition, Top Laureate at Queen Elisabeth, Tchaikovsky and Munich ARD Competitions, and a distinguished faculty member at Shanghai Conservatory will perform an all-Mozart program with Yin Zheng, Piano Professor at Virginia Commonwealth University.

University Singers Post-Tour Concert

Stephen Coker, Conductor

This 34-voice choir’s tour repertoire includes music of Victoria, Brahms, Britten, Aharon Harlap, and Hyo-won Woo as well as folk music Uruguay, Nigeria, and Finland.

About Stephen Coker:
Stephen Coker is Director of Choral Activities and Associate Professor of Music at Chapman University.  Prior to this appointment, Dr. Coker served on the faculties of Portland State University (2006-2009), the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music (CCM) from 2000-2006, and Oklahoma City University (OCU) from 1975-2000.  Learn more...

Event Title: University Choir & University Singers in Concert
Description:
University Choir & University Singers in Concert

Stephen Coker, Conductor

Works performed will include music of Paul Mealor, Morten Lauridsen, Benjamin Britten, and Bob Chilcott.

About Stephen Coker:
Stephen Coker is Director of Choral Activities and Associate Professor of Music at Chapman University.  Prior to this appointment, Dr. Coker served on the faculties of Portland State University (2006-2009), the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music (CCM) from 2000-2006, and Oklahoma City University (OCU) from 1975-2000.  Learn more...

Big Band & Jazz Combos

Albert Alva, Director

Since 2005, Albert Alva has taken the Chapman University Big Band and Jazz Combos to new musical heights.  Besides performing standard repertoire in all genres of jazz, Chapman University Big Band students are very fortunate to perform original works from the library of jazz drum legend Louie Bellson.

About Albert Alva:
After graduating Chaffey College, Albert Alva attended the Los Angeles Jazz Workshop.  He has toured with Ben Vereen, Leslie Uggams, Jerry Lewis, Michael Feinstein, Ann Hampton Calloway, and Ken Peplowski.  He has also played in various bands backing such artists as Mel Torme, Joe Williams, Diane Schuur, Jack Jones, and the Captain & Tennile.  Recording credits include Toni Tennile, Renee Olstead, Matt Catingub, Clark Terry, Louie Bellson, and Rosemary Clooney's last recording called "Sentimental Journey" for Concord Records.  It was nominated for a Grammy Award.  Learn more...

Artist-in-Residence in Recital - Milena Kitic, mezzo-soprano

Works by Rossini, Rachmaninoff, Montsalvatge, de Falla, and Obradors and arias from Werther and Carmen.

About Milena Kitic:
A star of the Belgrade Opera, Serbia (former Yugoslavia), Ms. Kitic made her debut in 1989 as Olga in Tchaikovsky's "Eugene Onegin".  She has performed with the National Theater in Belgrade for 8 years in a wide range of roles: from Rosina in Rossini's "Il Baribiere di Siviglia", Cherubino in Mozart's "Le Nozze di Figaro", Preziosilla in Verdi's "La Forza del Destino", Fenena in "Nabucco'', Bastien in "Bastien e Bastiena", Flora in "Traviata", Lola in "Cavalleria Rusticana", Mercedes in "Carmen", Orlofsky in "Die Fledermaus", Fiodor in "Boris Godunov" - to the title role of Carmen, and Principessa de Bouillon in Cilea's "Adriana Lecouvreur."  Learn more...

Faculty Recital - Karen Knecht, piano with Laszlo Mezo, cello

Program to be announced.

About Karen Knecht:
Karen Knecht, M.F.A., received her early musical training at the Juilliard School of Music. She went on to earn a Bachelor's degree in music from Indiana University where she studied with Sidney Foster and Abbey Simon.  She also holds a Master of Fine Arts Degree from The State University of New York at Buffalo where she worked with Frina Arshanska Boldt.  She has appeared as a duo piano partner with Tania Fleischer, Joseph Matthews, and as assisting artist with the duo Arshanska and Boldt.  Other duo partnerships have included performances with cellists Elizabeth Anderson and Richard Treat, and Los Angeles Philharmonic violinist Mischa Lefkowitz and hornist Brian Drake.  Learn more...

About Laszlo Mezo:
Born in Budapest, Hungary, Laszlo Mezo gained national recognition as one of the top musicians of his generation when he won First Prize in the “Kertész Ottó Memorial Competition” at the young age of 18. Since then, he has won numerous other competitions which have brought him international recognition including the Fourth Prize in the “Antonio Janigro Junior International Competition” in 1998, Second Prize in the “International Dávid Popper Competition for Young Cellists” in 2000, the Special Prize in the “International Dávid Popper Cello Competition” in 2004, and First Prize in the “Ima Hogg International Competition” in 2008.  Learn more...

Chapman University Wind Symphony

Christopher Nicholas, Music Director and Conductor

The Chapman University Wind Symphony has earned a reputation for its breadth of musicality and consistently high level of performance.  Under the direction of Christopher Nicholas, the Wind Symphony performs a wide variety of repertoire, including established wind masterworks, transcriptions, and newly commissioned works.  Program to include Symphony no. I, The Lord of the Rings, I. Gandalf (de Meij), Enigma Variations (Elgar/Slocum), The Pines of Rome, IV. Pines of the Appian Way (Respighi/Duker), Blue Shades (Ticheli), Jocuri Poporale Romanesti (Bartok/Goto), and Angels With Dirty Faces (Bonney).

About Christopher Nicholas:
Dr. Christopher Nicholas is the recently appointed Director of Bands and Director of Woodwind and Brass Studies at the Hall-Musco Conservatory of Music at Chapman University. Prior to his appointment at the Chapman Conservatory, Dr. Nicholas served as the Director of Bands at Colorado State University, as well as on the music faculties of the University of Wyoming, Grinnell College, and Kirkwood College. Dr. Nicholas received degrees from University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (BME) and the University of Iowa (MA, DMA).  Learn more...

University Women's Choir in Concert

Angel Vázquez-Ramos, Conductor

Under the direction of Angel Vázquez-Ramos, the University Women’s Choir performs advanced literature for women’s voices, from the Renaissance to the most recent compositions.

About Angel Vázquez-Ramos:
Angel M. Vázquez-Ramos, Assistant Professor of Choral Music at Chapman University, is a native of Carolina, Puerto Rico. He teaches undergraduate courses in music education and conducts the University Women's Choir. In addition, he conducts the Vocal Jazz Ensemble and supervises secondary music student teachers.  Dr. Vázquez-Ramos is founder and director of the Chapman University Summer Choral Music Camp.  Before completing his doctoral studies at Florida State University, he taught secondary choral music for seven years in Pinellas County Schools in the Tampa Bay Area. In addition, he worked as director of music ministries in churches in both Largo and Tallahassee, Florida. His research interest includes: teacher preparation, rehearsal techniques, adolescent choirs, and assessment in music education.  Learn more...

Sholund Scholarship Concert

This annual concert of the Hall-Musco Conservatory of Music will showcase the talents of our music students and will include both vocal and instrumental performances.

Program to be announced.

Hosted annually by the A. Gary Anderson Center for Economic Research at Chapman University, the nationally recognized Economic Forecast Conference utilizes the faculty and student developed Chapman Econometric Model to analyze the California economy and greater global economic trends to provide national and local businesses and organizations with the information they need to make more effective planning and investment decisions. 

Review the economic trends of the past six months and learn what is in store for the remainder of 2014 and into 2015!

 

General Admission: $150

*Sponsorship opportunities available. Please call (714) 997-6841.

This year's conference will be held on Thursday, June 19, 2014 at the Renée and Henry Segerstrom Concert Hall at Segerstrom Center for the Arts.

Time

7:30 A.M. – Doors Open and Continental Breakfast

8:30 A.M. – Conference

Parking

Complimentary self-parking available at the Park Center Garage and at the Center Tower Garage adjacent the Segerstrom Center for the Arts.

See map for details.

President’s Piano Series – Alexander Toradze and Vakhtang Kodanashvili

Under the artistic direction of Grace Fong, each year the President's Piano Series presents internationally acclaimed pianists and ensembles from throughout the world that perform both solo and chamber music recitals. Alexander Toradze is universally recognized as a masterful virtuoso in the grand Romantic tradition.  He has enriched the Great Russian pianistic heritage with his own interpretative conceptions, deeply poetic lyricism, and intensely emotional excitement. A native of Tbilisi, Georgia, Vakhtang Kodanashvili began his musical education at The Georgian Special School of Music, studying under Marina Gelashvili, and had his orchestral debut at the age of nine.
Salmon Recital Hall 7:30pm
$25 general admission; $15 senior citizens, alumni and non-Chapman students
Subscription tickets also available.

President’s Piano Series – Jeffrey Siegel

Under the artistic direction of Grace Fong, each year the President's Piano Series presents internationally acclaimed pianists and ensembles from throughout the world that perform both solo and chamber music recitals. Internationally acclaimed pianist Jeffrey Siegel has been soloist with the world's great orchestras. Abroad, these have included the Berlin Philharmonic, London Symphony, Philharmonic and Philharmonia, Moscow State Symphony, Munich's Bayerischer Rundfunk, the Amsterdam, Oslo and Stockholm Philharmonic Orchestras, Orchestra of La Scala and NHK Symphony of Japan.
Salmon Recital Hall 7:30pm
$25 general admission; $15 senior citizens, alumni and non-Chapman students
Subscription tickets also available.

President’s Piano Series – Christina and Michelle Naughton

Under the artistic direction of Grace Fong, each year the President's Piano Series presents internationally acclaimed pianists and ensembles from throughout the world that perform both solo and chamber music recitals.  Christina and Michelle Naughton have been hailed by the San Francisco Examiner for their “stellar musicianship, technical mastery, and awe-inspiring artistry.”  The Naughtons made their European debut at Herkulesaal in Munich, where the Sueddeutsche Zeitung proclaimed them “an outstanding piano duo”.
Salmon Recital Hall 7:30pm
$25 general admission; $15 senior citizens, alumni and non-Chapman students
Subscription tickets also available.

President's Piano Series
Subscription Package

Featuring four internationally renowned pianists:


 Alexander Toradze and Vakhtang Kodanashvili
Duo Piano Concert

Thursday, February 6, 2014
7:30pm


Jeffrey Siegel

Thursday, March 6, 2014
7:30pm


Christina and Michelle Naughton

Thursday, April 3, 2014
7:30pm

Grace Fong, Artistic Director

The President’s Piano Series presents internationally acclaimed pianists and ensembles from throughout the world in both solo and chamber music recitals. In addition to evening performances, there will also be educational master class opportunities open to the public. 

These concerts are presented as part of a "Subscription Series" - individual concert tickets can also be purchased in advance.

Opera Chapman presents
Le Nozze di Figaro (The Marriage of Figaro)
Friday, April 25, 2014
In collaboration with The Chapman Orchestra

Peter Atherton, Artistic Director
Carol Neblett & David Alt, Associate Directors
Daniel Alfred Wachs, Conductor

The Marriage of Figaro is an opera buffa (comic opera) in four acts composed in 1786 by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, with an Italian libretto written by Lorenzo Da Ponte, based on a stage comedy by Pierre Beaumarchais. Sung in Italian with dialogue in English.

About Peter Atherton:
Bass-baritone Peter Atherton has had the joy of performing over forty-five roles ranging from Seneca in The Coronation of Poppea to Frederick in A Little Night Music.  His operatic credits include performances with the Los Angeles Opera, Seattle Opera, Baltimore Opera, Lyric Opera Cleveland, Wolf Trap Opera, Virginia Opera, San Francisco Opera Touring Division, Opera Atelier, Cairo Opera and the Operafestival of Rome and Verona.  He has performed with such conductors as Leonard Bernstein, Pierre Boulez, Lucas Foss, James Conlon, Kurt Herbert Adler, David Effron and Myung-Whun Chung.  Learn more...

About Carol Neblett:
One of America's greatest and most acclaimed sopranos, Carol Neblett's career has spanned over forty years, performing opera's most coveted roles in the world's greatest opera houses, including the Metropolitan Opera, La Scala, Covent Garden, San Francisco Opera, Salzburg, Hamburg and Chicago Lyric Opera.  Learn more...

About David Alt:
David Alt moved to Southern California after teaching for 21 years as Professor of Voice, Chairman of the Department of Vocal Performance and Program Director for Musical Theatre in the Frost School of Music at the University of Miami.  He received his DMA degree from the University of Iowa and a Certificate from the Conservatoire de Musique, Geneve, Switzerland.  Learn more...

About Daniel Alfred Wachs:
Conductor Daniel Alfred Wachs emerged on the international scene following his debut with the Mozarteum Orchestra of Salzburg, leading a world première by Toshio Hosokawa at the Grosses Festspielhaus. The Austrian press praised “Engaging, rhythmically inspired, precise in its execution, the “Mambo” was equal to a performance by Gustavo Dudamel and the Simón Bolívar Youth Orchestra!” Learn more...

Le Nozze di Figaro (The Marriage of Figaro)
Saturday, April 26, 2014
In collaboration with The Chapman Orchestra

Chapman University Frances Smith Center Presents:

Maggie Baumann, MA, LMFT, CEDS - Working with Eating Disorders

Tickets.Ticket Name: Chapman MFT Students and Chapman Employees

Description:
Chapman University Frances Smith Center Presents:

Lisa Maurel, MA, LMFT

Essential Components of Affirmative Therapy with Trans* Clients

This advanced course will address the essential aspects of affirmative therapy with trans*r and gender diverse clients and provide a multi-cultural approach to providing affirmative psychotherapy that is multi-culturally informed and client centered.  Ethical considerations in the delivery of therapeutic services will be addressed.

Tickets.Ticket Name: Chapman MFT Students and Chapman Employees

Description:
Chapman University Frances Smith Center Presents:

Elizabeth D'Arrigo-Patrick, PhD(c), MFTI

Medical Family Therapy

 

Medical Family Therapy is a growing area of practice for MFTs and will continue to expand as our healthcare system changes.  This presentation will be an introduction to Medical Family Therapy and will include current research, trends, job opportunities and opportunities for further training.

Tickets.Ticket Name: Chapman MFT Students and Chapman Employees

Event Title: Men's Basketball - Chapman vs. La Verne
Women's Basketball - Chapman vs La Verne
Men's Basketball - Chapman vs. Pomona Pitzer
Women's Basketball - Chapman vs Pomona Pitzer
UPB Goes to the LA Zoo!
Description:
What’s better than kicking off the new semester with Chapman UPB on our first weekend adventure? Find out what happens when UPB journeys to the Los Angeles Zoo to mingle with wild animals from across the globe including Indian Rhinos! Want to learn more about what the LA Zoo has to offer? Check it out here: http://www.lazoo.org/animals/.

FREE bus transportation is included!

Spaces are limited! Registration will be open until at 5:00pm on February 7th or until spaces are filled.


UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.
We are pleased to announce the fourth annual “Opportunities in Phytosanitary Irradiation for Fresh Produce Workshop”, March 25-26, 2014 at Chapman University in Orange, CA.

Event Title: Guest Artist in Recital - Nadia Shpachenko, piano
Description:
Guest Artist in Recital - Nadia Shpachenko, piano

"Music for a New B'ak'tun," a program of newly written works for solo piano (with toy piano, percussion and electronics) by American composers Tom Flaherty, James Matheson, Adam Schoenberg and Peter Yates.

About Nadia Shpachenko:
Pianist Nadia Shpachenko-Gottesman has performed extensively in solo recitals and with orchestras in major venues across North America, Europe and Asia. Described by critics as a "truly inspiring and brilliant pianist...spellbinding in sensitivity and mastery of technique," she recently toured Mexico with Orquesta de Baja California, performed with the Kharkov Philharmonic, the Ukrainian National Symphony and the Ukrainian National Radio Symphony Orchestras in Ukraine and the San Bernardino Symphony Orchestra in California. An enthusiastic promoter of contemporary music, she has given world and national premieres of dozens of piano, string piano and toy piano works by composers such as Leon Kirchner, George Crumb, Henry Cowell, Elliott Carter, Iannis Xenakis, Peter Yates, Tom Flaherty, Dave Kopplin, Yury Ishchenko and others.  Learn more...

Event Title: How To Build Your Full And Rewarding Private Pract
Description:

The Vagina Monologues is an episodic play written by Eve Ensler made up of a varying number of monologues focused on female empowerment. This year's production of the show will run from Friday, February 21st through Sunday, February 23rd. This production is sponsored by the Chapman University Office of Housing & Residence Life and benefits The Shodhini Institute.

Event Title: Alumni Pre-Show Mixer & Greek Skit Night 2014
Description:
Whether you were the star of the show or a member of the choir, no one can forget their Skit Night performance on the main stage of Memorial Hall.  What chapter will take home the Greek Skit Night Prize in 2014?…will it be yours?

Come home to your alma mater on Friday, April 4, 2014 to support your  chapter affiliation, reconnect with friends, and find out who will create the biggest and best performance for the year.  Catch up and network with fellow Alumni during the Alumni Pre-Show Mixer beginning at 5:30 p.m. in Argyros Forum Room 209 A, B, and C. Enjoy light appetizers, beverages, including beer and wine, skit predictions, fun photos, and fond memories in a relaxed setting surrounded by your Greek brothers and sisters from days gone by.

At 6:30 p.m. , you can choose to make your way to the live performance at Memorial Hall and sit in a reserved Alumni seating section OR you can stay and continue the party--while watching a live webcast of the performances alongside friends.

Either way, the night is yours to celebrate and reminisce about your great times in the Greek community here at Chapman University!

Tickets.Ticket Name: Pre-Mixer Reception AND Greek Skit Show Ticket

Description:
50 Year Club Luncheon

Join us for our annual Chapman University 50 Year Club Luncheon, honoring esteemed Chapman alumni 50 years (and beyond) after their graduation. Special highlights of this event include special guest President Jim Doti, induction of the Class of 1964, and a delicious dessert buffet. Please be sure to invite members of your family who also attended Chapman University to celebrate another milestone year with you!

10:30 a.m. Memorial Service with Rev. Nancy Brink and Dr. Gail Stearns
Yoder Sanctuary, Wallace All Faiths Chapel, Fish Interfaith Center

11:30 a.m., 50 Year Club Luncheon and Induction of the Class of 1964 with President Doti
Argyros Forum, Room 209, Chapman University

(PLEASE NOTE THE LOCATION CHANGE ABOVE)

Dessert Buffet Reception to Follow

If you would like to make a gift to the Alumni Scholarship Fund, please click here. Thank you.
Venue: Town and Gown Gardens, Elliott Alumni House

Description:
Class of 1964 Reunion Weekend * MAY 21-24, 2014

Be a part of this milestone celebration - come home to Chapman University  and enjoy all the wonders of our campus home today, as you relish in the fond memories and dear friendships of days gone by.

For a complete Reunion schedule, please visit our website at www.chapman.edu/1964reunion

If you would like to make your 50th Reunion Gift to the Class of '64 Memorial Scholarship, please click here.

Tickets.Ticket Name: Additional Class of 1964 Reunion Memory Book

Description:
Join Chapman University Program Board (UPB) on a hike through Moro Canyon in Laguna Beach’s famed Crystal Cove State Park. With a beautiful hike through the wooded mountains ending at one of the last remaining natural seashore views in Orange County. You won’t want to miss this Saturday adventure!

To register, email chapmanupb@gmail.com before all the spots are full! This is a free trip, with transportation and lunch included!

 

This hike is applicable to all levels of physical skill. UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone. Please contact us for accommodations!

The joy that TV legend Huell Howser shared with generations of Californians infuses a new permanent exhibit to be housed in Chapman University’s Leatherby Libraries. “That’s Amazing! Thirty Years of Huell Howser and California’s Gold” opens to the public Saturday, March 29, with an open house that will include live appearances by many of the stars of Howser’s public television program, plus screenings of a new documentary on the making of California’s Gold by Chapman University film professor Jeff Swimmer. The exhibit is sponsored by the Automobile Club of Southern California, and after March 29 it will be open daily during regular library hours.

Event Title: Presidential Summit Training Hike #2: Santiago Pea
Description:
Panther Escapes is leading the second hike in the series of treks in preparation for the final summit of San Gorgonia.  This week we'll be hiking to Santiago Peak- a 14 mile in-and-out trail leading up over 4000 feet of elevation.

Lunch and transportation will be provided!  Meet at the volleyball courts at 7:00am.

Tickets are $10, but when you show up Saturday morning you'll get $5 back!
Venue: Santiago Peak Trail Via Holy Jim Falls

Description:
Join Chapman University Program Board (UPB) on a cultural art exploration at the world-famous Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA).  From Alexander Calder’s revolutionary modern sculptures to four Southern California abstract classicists’ exhibitions, LACMA offers a diverse experience sure to bring out the artistic enthusiast in anyone.   

Free round-trip bus transportation will be provided. Spaces are limited! Registration will be open until at 5:00pm on February 21st or until spaces are filled.

 

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.
Venue: LACMA: Los Angeles County Museum of Art

Description:
Tired of your friends showing off their boring gold fish in their residence hall rooms? Then come join UPB on an underwater escapade to the Aquarium of the Pacific in Long Beach! You will see otters, baby penguins, jellyfish, seahorses and tons of different species of fish! Tickets start at $12.00. Want to learn more? www.aquariumofpacific.org  Sea you then!

Free bus transportation will be provided. Meet at 255 E. Walnut Ave, Orange, CA (next to the Allred Aquatics Center). 

Spaces are limited! Registration will be open until at 5:00pm on February 28th or until spaces are filled.

 
UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.
Venue: Aquarium of the Pacific - Long Beach

Event Title: PILF Dinner and Silent Auction - Student Ticket
Description:
This site is for Chapman University Students only. Please purchase a general admission ticket HERE.

Join us for the Chapman University Fowler School of Law's Public Interest Law Foundation (PILF) 2014 Awards Dinner honoring the dedicated work of our students and community leaders in public interest law. Proceeds from the dinner and auction will support PILF's public interest summer jobs grant program. Planned auction items include professional sporting event tickets, signed music and film memorabilia, fine wines, deluxe gift baskets, restaurant passes and much more. View more information by clicking HERE.


Ticket sales end Friday, March 21
Venue: Celebrations by Turnip Rose, Costa Mesa

Description: SCIAC Post Season Tournament

Event Title: SCIAC Women's Basketball Post Season Tournament
Description: SCIAC Post Season Tournament

University Program Board (UPB) and Panther Escapes have teamed up to bring you the opportunity to shred up the mountain before the season ends. Whether you’re a veteran skier, or haven’t even seen the snow before, this trip has everything needed to accommodate all skill levels.If you’ve had the desire to challenge yourself and venture one of Southern California’s tallest mountains then this is the perfect trip for you! Free bus transportation will be provided.

Ski and snowboard rentals, as well as lessons, will be available for any newcomers.Your ticket includes a meal voucher for lunch! Transportation, lunch, lift ticket and rentals for only $30! This is a value of at least $80-$100!

Spaces are limited! Registration will be open until 5:00pm on March 5th or until spaces are filled.

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone. Please contact us for accommodations!

Tickets.Ticket Name: Skiing w/ Lessons (lift ticket & rental included)

Description:
Women in Focus is an annual conference at Dodge College featuring a panel of the most prominent women in the film profession participating in an open discussion with students and the community regarding their experiences in the industry.

This year’s panel spotlights the Business of Entertainment with moderator Dawn Taubin, Chief Marketing Officer, DreamWorks Animation, and the following panelists:

Sue Kroll, President, Worldwide Marketing and International Distribution,Warner Bros. Pictures; The Great Gatsby (2013), Man of Steel (2013), Argo (2012),Dark Knight Trilogy

Terry Press, Co-president, CBS Films; Last Vegas (2013), Inside Llewyn Davis (2013), The Woman in Black (2012), Salmon Fishing in the Yemen (2011)

JoAnne Sellar, Producer; The Master (2012), There Will Be Blood (2007), Boogie Nights (1997), Magnolia (2009)

And many more!

Please make plans to join us on Friday, April 11 at 1:30 p.m. in Folino Theater at Dodge College of Film and Media Arts.

Event Title: SCIAC Men's Basketball Post Season Tournament
Description: SCIAC Post Season Tournament

Join Chapman University Program Board (UPB) and the Chapman AirSoft & Paintball Club on an adventurous trip to go Paintballing at the Hollywood Sports Park! You read that right, paintballing!

 

This is a one-time experience to be able to shoot paint at your friends for only $15 ($40+ Value)! Your ticket includes equipment rental, 400 paintballs, and round-trip transportation.

 

There are a limited number of discounted tickets so sign up while you can. Registration will be open until 5:00pm on March 14thor until spaces are filled. 

 

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.

Senior Week 2014!

UPB and Senior Legacy presents Senior Week, a celebration of the class of 2014! Senior Week will be held Monday April 21 - April 27. This is your last chance to make memories with your Chapman friends and carry-on the annual Senior Week tradition! 

Check out the schedule below for dates/times. Three events require an RSVP and you can make your ticket selection for those events below. The remaining events are free! Transportation is provided and required for all off-campus events. 

*RSVP Required

*Monday, April 21 (7:00-10:30pm) - Dave & Busters Power Hour ($10)

Chapman is going to get its game on! Show your skills at the arcade or chill out at the bar to watch the big game. Your ticket gets you - $15 Power Card and delicious buffet dinner including salad, rosemary chicken breast and much more! Special food options will be available.

 Tuesday, April 22 (7:00-9:00pm) - Panther Pool Party - (Free)

Seniors are taking over the Masson Family Beach Club! Free food and fun music will make this a night you won't want to miss!

 Wednesday, April 23 (11:00-2:00pm) - 20th Annual Spring Sizzle - (Free)

Chapman's favorite tradition is back! Bring your student ID and grab your special Senior gift from the UPB table. This year's Spring Sizzle will be bigger than ever featuring carnival games, student performances, and delicious food. The menu includes corn dogs, caramel apples, fresh fruit and ice cream!

Thursday, April 24 (8:00-11:00pm) - Taco Night @ The District - (Free)

The District is opening its doors to Chapman seniors! The first 100 seniors will receive free tacos and a live DJ will be playing your favorite music.

*Friday, April 25 (7:00-11:30pm) - Bowling Night @ BowlMor Anaheim - ($10)

Join us for two hours of bowling including a full dinner buffet. Your ticket gets you - unlimited bowling, shoe rental and a gourmet pizza dinner. Special food options are available. Cash bar for 21+. The best part is that Chapman has its own private party room! Participants must use the provided transporation round-trip.

*Saturday, April 26 (7:30am-6:45pm) - Catalina Island Trip - ($25)

Join us for a day-trip to beautiful Catalina Island. Seniors only! You'll have a fun-filled day of hiking, water activities, all while enjoying the beautiful scenery. Your ticket gets you - round-trip transportation aboard the Catalina Flyer, lunch, and bus transportation to the ferry terminal. This is an amazing deal - 60% off the regular price for the Catalina Flyer ($70). Participants must use the provided transportation round-trip.

*Sunday, April 27 (11:00am-1:00pm) - Senior Ring Day - (Free)

This is an invitation only event for seniors receiving their Chapman class ring! Seniors will be recognized and honored for all their accomplishments and welcomed into the alumni family.

Additional details can be found on UPB's Facebook Page

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone. Please contact us at chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations.

Tickets.Ticket Name: Senior Week - Dave & Busters Power Hour

Description: As the parent of a student in Greek Life, the Parents Ambassador Council invites you to the all new Greek Skit Parent Viewing Party! Enjoy refreshments and camaraderie with fellow Greek parents while you watch the performances on live streaming video. And for the first time, parents will have the opportunity to share the excitement of the awards presentation in Attallah Piazza.

Event Title: Elie Wiesel: Evening of Stories and Story Telling
Description:
Readers Theatre presentation of excerpts from King Solomon and His Magic Ring and
The Golem by Elie Wiesel with a reading by Elie Wiesel, Nobel Peace Prize
Laureate and Distinguished Presidential Fellow, Chapman University.

Stories and Memories: From Always and Now with Elie Wiesel, Nobel Peace Prize
Laureate and Distinguished Presidential Fellow, Chapman University.

Q&A with playwright Terrence McNally
Terrence McNally is an American playwright who has received four Tony Awards, an Emmy Award, two Guggenheim Fellowships, a Rockefeller Grant , the Lucille Lortel Award and the Hull-Warriner Award. 
Tickets are $10 and free to the Chapman community.

Basics of Self-Injury

Angela Kahn, M.A., LMFT

Tickets.Ticket Name: MFT Students, Chapman Students and Employees

Description:
Trauma Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy

Anaissa Ibrahimi, M.A., MFTI

Tickets.Ticket Name: MFT Students, Chapman Students and Employees

Description:
TRAUMA 101

Susan Jester, M.A., LMFT,  Associate Director of the Frances Smith Center for Individual and Family Therapy

What are we learning from neuroscience that is transforming our understanding of trauma?  Understand how trauma is registered in the brain and the body, and how standard therapy techniques may hinder the healing process.  Increase your knowledge about the various types of trauma, how to recognize symptoms, and learn about promising new treatment modalities.

THIS EVENT IS ONLY OPEN TO CHAPMAN MFT ALUMNI, FACULTY, AND STUDENTS

Senior Convocation and President's Toast

Senior Convocation will be held Thursday, May 22, at 7 p.m on Bert C. Williams Mall.  This ceremony is designed for seniors and their families as we honor the achievements of the Class of 2014. 

The President’s Toast to the seniors will follow immediately in The Fahmy Attallah, Ph.D. Piazza.

Event Title: UPB Goes to see the LA Clippers!
Description:
Join Chapman University Program Board (UPB) as we indulge in our competitive side and watch the LA Clippers take on the Sacramento Kings.

With superstars like Blake Griffin and Chris Paul, the Clippers are one of the best teams in the NBA! This is your chance to see them for free! There are a limited number of tickets so sign up while you can.

Free bus transportation and lunch will be provided. Registration will be open until at 5:00pm on April 12th or until spaces are filled. 

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.

Join Chapman University Program Board (UPB) for a day trip to Balboa Island in Newport Beach!

From a free lunch to playing at the Balboa Fun Zone, and spending time by the water, this trip is a great afternoon getaway. Best of all, the trip is free! There is a limited amount of tickets, so sign up as soon as you can!

Bus transportation is provided. Spaces are limited! Registration will be open until 5:00pm on April 18th or until spaces are filled.

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.

American Celebration Opening Night, on Friday, October 31st, includes a a spectacular live song-and-dance stage show produced by Chapman University's students and faculty. Guests are also invited to enjoy a post-performance dessert reception. American Celebration has grown to become one of Orange County's largest fundraising events, with proceeds supporting the Chapman Scholarship Fund.  American Celebration is, in a word, extraordinary.

Ticket Options:

General Seating: $50.00 (Rows L-V, Balcony)

Sponsorship Level Seating (Rows B-K) *To purchase a sponsorship, please contact the Office of Special Events at (714) 628-2750 or events@chapman.edu.

Title Sponsor (16 Sponsorship Level Tickets, Company/Family Name Recognition in all printed material and website as "Official Title Sponsor", Full Page Advertisement, 2 Reserved Tables at Dessert Reception, Chapman University Ambassador Escort): $5,000

Presenting Sponsor (12 Sponsorship Level Tickets, Full Page Advertisement, Program and Website Recognition, 1 Reserved Table at Dessert Reception, Chapman University Ambassador Escort): $2,000

Gold Star Sponsor (8 Sponsorship Level Tickets, Program and Website Recognition, Full Page Advertisement): $1,000

Silver Star Sponsor (4 Sponsorship Level Tickets, Program and Website Recognition, Half Page Advertisement): $500

Bronze Star Sponsor (2 Sponsorship Level Tickets, Program and Website Recognition): $250

Full-color program advertisments are available to purchase.

Full-Page $200

Half-Page $100

For more information, or to purchase a sponsorship or advertisement, please contact (714) 628-2750 or events@chapman.edu

Chamber Music / OC's Season Finale will feature some of the most celebrated chamber music from the French repertoire including works of Debussy, Faure, and the highly virtuosic Piano Trio of Maurice Ravel.  Artists will include Colin Carr, Britain's foremost concert cellist, Julian Martin, distinguished Professor of Piano at The Juilliard School, and violinist Iryna Krechkovsky performing on the coveted 1689 "Baumgartner" Stradivarius.

The overwhelming response to last year’s TEDxChapmanU convinced us to return with another remarkable slate of presenters this year. Continuing the theme of Icons, Geniuses & Mavericks, the 2014 TEDxChapmanU is destined to challenge and inspire you with thought-provoking talks from extraordinary men and women. Chapman University is honored to present TEDxChapmanU in historic and intimate Memorial Hall.

Learn more at www.tedxchapmanu.com
The Cecil Awards celebrates the student achievements at Dodge College of film and Media Arts at Chapman University.

Graduating seniors who have applied for stoles acknowledging their commitment to diversity and equity will be recognized along with nearly 30 award recipients!

Refreshments will be provided.

Event Title: An Introduction to Sand Tray Work
Description:
Chapman University The Frances Smith Center for Indvidual and Family Therapy

Naveen Jonathan, Ph.D, LMFT

An Introduction to Sand Tray Work

Learn the basics of conducting a sand tray therapy session, the different models of sand tray work, and the connection with play therapy.

 

THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO CHAPMAN MFT ALUMNI, STAFF, AND STUDENTS ONLY

TICKET SALES CLOSE ON: JULY 29, 2014

Due to the presentation material there is limited space for this event.

Address: Crean Hall, 501 W. Palm Ave, Orange, CA 92868

Parking: Palm Lot located across the street from Crean Hall.  Please park in spots that are NOT marked "Chapman", by the fence of the railroad track.

Hosted annually by the A. Gary Anderson Center for Economic Research at Chapman University, the nationally recognized Economic Forecast Conference utilizes the faculty and student developed Chapman Econometric Model to analyze the California economy and greater global economic trends to provide national and local businesses and organizations with the information they need to make more effective planning and investment decisions. 

Review the economic trends of the past six months and learn what is in store for the remainder of 2014 and into 2015!

 

General Admission: $185

*Sponsorship opportunities available. See Sponsorship Opportunities HERE, or call (714) 997-6841.

This year's conference will be held on Wednesday, December 3, 2014 at the Renée and Henry Segerstrom Concert Hall.

Time

1:30 P.M. - Doors Open

2:00 P.M. - Conference Begins

3:30 P.M. - Reception

Parking

Complimentary self-parking available at the Park Center Garage and at the Center Tower Garage adjacent the Segerstrom Center for the Arts.

See map for details.
Chapman University hosts  its first home game of the 2014-2015 football season against Northwest Conference opponent Linfield College.  Game time is 7pm.
HOMECOMING WEEKEND: Chapman University hosts its second SCIAC game of the 2014-2015 football season against  Pomona Pitzer College.  Game time is 7pm.

Keyboard Conversations with Jeffrey Siegel: The Romantic Music of Chopin
Chapman University President's Fellow and Keyboard Conversation pianist, Jeffrey Siegel, presents THE ROMANTIC MUSIC OF CHOPIN – heroic Polonaises, dreamy Nocturnes, vivacious Waltzes, and the mystery behind one of Chopin’s most beloved and familiar works, the Fantasy Impromptu.
Salmon Recital Hall
7:30pm
Package Ticket: $50 includes admission to both Keyboard Conversation performances and preferred reserved event seating.
Single tickets are also available: $35 general admission; $20 senior citizens, alumni, non-Chapman students and Chapman community

Keyboard Conversations with Jeffrey Siegel: The Power and Passion of Beethoven
Chapman University President's Fellow and Keyboard Conversation pianist, Jeffrey Siegel, presents THE POWER AND PASSION OF BEETHOVEN. This concert includes some of Beethoven’s well-known pieces with interesting stories about their origins and musical ingredients - The Rage over a Lost Penny, the Moonlight Sonata, the "Farewell Sonata" (who was leaving and why was Beethoven so deeply affected?)
Salmon Recital Hall
7:30pm
Package Ticket: $50 includes admission to both Keyboard Conversation performances and preferred reserved event seating.
Single tickets are also available: $35 general admission; $20 senior citizens, alumni, non-Chapman students and Chapman community

Hot Mikado
Book and Lyrics Adapted by David H. Bell; Music Adapted and Arranged by Rob Bowman; Based on The Mikado by W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan
Directed by Nina LeNoir, Music Direction by Bill Brown

In a land where outlandish laws sentence people to death for almost any indiscretion, jazz, and the blues, and gospel are spoken fluently. Hot Mikado weaves a tale of hilarious proportions and, despite the life or death stakes, characters still find time to tap their toes and do their fair share of scatting. Based on the classic Gilbert and Sullivan operetta, this musical stays faithful to the original in song and story, but sets everything in a 1940s jazz club setting, mixing the two into a wild and entertaining evening of theatre.

Waltmar Theatre
7:30pm, with an additional performance Oct. 11 at 2pm
$20 general admission; $15 senior citizens, students and alumni

Event Title: Angel's Baseball vs. Oakland A's (SOLD OUT)
Description:
Get your friends together for a fun outing to see the Orange County's baseball team, the LA Angels of Anaheim!

With superstars like Mike Trout and Albert Pujols, the Angels are one of the best teams in the MLB! This is your chance to see them compete with their rivals, the Oakland A's for only $5.00! There are a limited number of tickets so sign up while you can.

Free bus transportation will be provided. Registration will be open until at 12:00am on August 31 or until spaces are filled. 

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact orientation@chapman.edu for accommodations and questions.

Chapman University presents

A$AP Ferg

with DJ Kap Slap

University Program Board (UPB) and Chapman Radio present their 2014 fall concert featuring headliner A$AP Ferg with support from DJ Kap Slap. You won’t want to miss the biggest concert of the year at The Grove in Anaheim! Doors open at 8:00 p.m.

Tickets will be sold during Welcome Week for a special price of $15 until September 7th! The Regular ticket price will be $20 beginning September 8th. Any remaining tickets will be $25 at the door.

Ticket sales will be available online until 12:00 p.m. on September 19th and remaining tickets will be available at the door! 

 

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.

Event Title: Chapman University Goes to Six Flags! (SOLD OUT)
Description:
“It’s Playtime!” Get ready for a trip to Magic Mountain! University Program Board (UPB) Explore SoCal is going to Six Flags on Saturday, September 6th. For the special price of $25, students will get free transportation to thrilling rides and attractions throughout the day! Buses will leave campus at 10:00 a.m. and return at 9:00 p.m. 

Spaces are limited! Registration will be open until at 5:00 p.m. on September 5th or until spaces are filled.

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.
Venue: Six Flags Magic Mountain - Valencia, CA

Description:
“A dream is a wish your heart makes…” and UPB and Residence Life are going to make your dreams come true! Spend the entire day at the Happiest Place on Earth and hang out with Mickey and friends! Meet all of your Disney heroes, indulge in some Dole pineapple whip, and park-hop between Disneyland and California Adventure with the special parkhopper ticket price of ONLY $30.

Spaces are limited so reserve your spot now! There are two departure times and all buses arrive back to campus by 11:30 pm. 

UPB strives to make all events open and accessible to everyone, please contact chapmanupb@gmail.com for accommodations and questions.
